to go: kháw bpai rian thîi rooŋ-rian → He goes to study at school

to walk: kháw dəən bpai tâlàat → He walks to the market
to run: wan-níi phǒm wîŋ cháw → Today I ran in the morning
to play: chǎn chɔ̂ɔp lên gâae-lae → I like to play guitar

to want: phǒm yàak bpai thîiao → I want to go out
to love: chǎn rák khun → I love you
to like: chǎn chɔ̂ɔp gin phǐt-sàa → I like to eat pizza
to hate: kháw glìat ngaan bâan → He hates homework

to remember: chǎn jam khun dâai → I remember you

to get up: phǒm lúk-khʉ̂n jàak dtàaeŋ → I get up from the bed
to cry: lûuk-rák róoŋ-hâi pŏr hǎa mâae → The child cries looking for mom

to wash face: phǒm láaŋ-nâa sà-màt chái náam yen → I wash my face with cold water
to watch TV: chǎn duu thii-wii bplàao → I’m just watching TV
